Access H2O Gains/Lift Tables

Retrieve either a single or many Gains/Lift tables from H2O objects.

h2o.gainsLift(object, ...)

# S4 method for H2OModel
h2o.gainsLift(object, newdata, valid = FALSE,
  xval = FALSE, ...)

# S4 method for H2OModelMetrics
h2o.gainsLift(object)

Arguments

object

Either an H2OModel object or an H2OModelMetrics object.
…

further arguments to be passed to/from this method.
newdata

An H2OFrame object that can be scored on. Requires a valid response column.
valid

Retrieve the validation metric.
xval

Retrieve the cross-validation metric.

Value

Calling this function on H2OModel objects returns a Gains/Lift table corresponding to the predict function.

Details

The H2OModelMetrics version of this function will only take H2OBinomialMetrics objects.

See also

predict for generating prediction frames, h2o.performance for creating H2OModelMetrics.

Examples

library(h2o)
h2o.init()
#> Reading in config file: ./../../../../.h2oconfig
#> 
#> H2O is not running yet, starting it now...
#> Warning: cannot open file '/Users/terrytangyuan/h2o-3/h2o-r/h2o/branch.txt': No such file or directory
#> Error in file(con, "r"): cannot open the connection
prosPath <- system.file("extdata", "prostate.csv", package="h2o")
hex <- h2o.uploadFile(prosPath)
#> Error in h2o.getConnection(): No active connection to an H2O cluster. Did you run `h2o.init()` ?
hex[,2] <- as.factor(hex[,2])
#> Error in is.H2OFrame(x): object 'hex' not found
model <- h2o.gbm(x = 3:9, y = 2, distribution = "bernoulli",
                 training_frame = hex, validation_frame = hex, nfolds=3)
#> Error in is.H2OFrame(training_frame): object 'hex' not found
h2o.gainsLift(model)              ## extract training metrics
#> Error in h2o.gainsLift(model): object 'model' not found
h2o.gainsLift(model, valid=TRUE)  ## extract validation metrics (here: the same)
#> Error in h2o.gainsLift(model, valid = TRUE): object 'model' not found
h2o.gainsLift(model, xval =TRUE)  ## extract cross-validation metrics
#> Error in h2o.gainsLift(model, xval = TRUE): object 'model' not found
h2o.gainsLift(model, newdata=hex) ## score on new data (here: the same)
#> Error in h2o.gainsLift(model, newdata = hex): object 'model' not found
# Generating a ModelMetrics object
perf <- h2o.performance(model, hex)
#> Error in is(model, "H2OModel"): object 'model' not found
h2o.gainsLift(perf)               ## extract from existing metrics object
#> Error in h2o.gainsLift(perf): object 'perf' not found
